sub_title: Senior Vice President and Chief Legal & Public Affairs Officer at Booking.com
summary:
As SVP and Chief Legal & Public Affairs Officer (General Counsel), Maria Fernanda Rocha Barros is responsible for legal, compliance and public affairs matters worldwide for Booking.com. Maria is passionate about ensuring companies grow their business in an ethical and sustainable way. 

Prior to joining Booking.com, Maria was the European General Counsel of AB InBev, the leading global brewer, where she was responsible for legal, compliance, government relations, external communications, crisis management, security and CSR. Prior to that, Maria held a number of roles at AB InBev in the Company's Global Headquarters and Mexican operations, where she worked on various M&As deals (including the $20 billion combination with Grupo Modelo in 2013, and the $100 billion combination with SABMiller in 2016), post-deal integrations and in growing AB InBev’s international markets development business. Before joining AB InBev, Maria worked at the law firm Simpson Thacher & Bartlett in New York as a corporate associate.

Born in London, Maria loves travelling and has lived in the UK, US, Brazil, Mexico and Belgium, and has now moved to the Netherlands with her family. Maria is passionate about her profession and truly believes in the role of in-house counsel as a force for good within companies and since October 2018 is a Board member of ACC Europe, the world's largest association of in-house lawyers. 

Maria holds a bachelor of laws degree from the Universidade de Sao Paulo, a Masters from Stanford Law School in Corporate Governance (Fundação Estudar Scholarship) and is admitted to practice in the United States (New York), England & Wales and Brazil.

school.name: Stanford University Graduate School of Business
Stanford University Graduate School of Business

awards.title: AB InBev/SAB Miller Matter of the Year (team) - Global Competition Review
Global Counsel Awards 2017 (team) - Winner, Global Competition Category – 2017
Global Counsel Awards 2013 (team) - Winner, Global Competition Category
Latin Lawyer, Deal of the Year 2013 (team) - Winner, M&A Category for AB InBev's acquisition of Grupo Modelo 2013
Fundação Estudar Scholarship
awards.description: Founded by Jorge Paulo Lemann, Marcel Telles and Beto Sicupira in 1991, Fundação Estudar is a non-profit organization that invests in the development of high-potential young people who will transform Brazil through work in various sectors. Since 1991, Fundação Estudar has been working to support the studies and career-paths of university students and recently-graduated Brazilians who wish to transform their country. Fundação Estudar believes that Brazil can become a better country if there were more young people who were determined to create an impact.

awards.title: First prize in “1st Essay Contest for Women Lawyers” by BOVESPA (individual)
awards.description: First prize in “1st Essay Contest for Women Lawyers” sponsored by BOVESPA (Sao Paulo’s Stock Exchange) and the Brazilian Bar Association, with research paper entitled “The Role of Securities Regulation in the Development of Brazilian Capital Market – Reflections on the Effectiveness of the Securities Regulation System”

awards.title: Winner of the “5th Essay Contest” sponsored by Brazil’s Securities and Exchange Commission and BOVESPA,
awards.description: Winner of the “5th Essay Contest” sponsored by Brazil’s Securities and Exchange Commission and BOVESPA, with paper entitled "Disclosure Policies in Brazilian Capital Market" (2004) – won trip to US to participate in programs at the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission and New York Stock Exchange

profile_positions.description:
- Responsible for all legal, compliance and public affairs matters of Booking.com worldwide, leading a team of ~150 professionals
- Member of the Leadership team and the Management Board 
- Secretary of the Supervisory Board of Booking Holdings B.V. (NL), from August 2020 - January 2023
profile_positions.title: SVP and Chief Legal & Public Affairs Officer (General Counsel/CLO)

profile_positions.description:
Recent Public Engagements: 
- "Panel discussion Great Expectations: Law is not just for lawyers. Today’s legal function is more than lawyers and legal advice. Why and how must it drive value to the enterprise and its customers?", Economist Impact, Business Innovation Summit 2023
- “From legal risk management to value creation”, Economist Impact, General Counsel Summit 2022
- Lecturer at FGV Law, Masters in Corporate Law, Contract Negotiations class, on “The impact of the Pandemic in the travel industry” 
- Speaker on "The outer limits of competition law enforcement – how far is too far?", GCR Brussels
- Key Note Speaker of Conexão Juridico" with the topic: "Como a pandemia alterou a dinâmica e a demanda por trabalho no mercado jurídico?" (The Pandemic’s impact in the legal market) for +200 Law Students/Recent Graduates in Brazil (Virtual)
- Facilitator of the ACC event: "Why in-house counsel should never waste a good crisis? Tips and tricks for maximizing your influence on the crisis during COVID-19" (Virtual)
- Speaker on the ACC and Eversheds Sutherland event on "Doing business in the Netherlands in a time of financial uncertainty" (Virtual)
- “The Transition from Biglaw to in-house – A Multinational vs. Startup Perspective”, Stanford Law School, California, USA
- “Whistleblowing and Compliance inside Corporations”, European Parliament, Belgium
- “Simplifying Anti-Corruption Due Diligence with artificial intelligence solutions – a look into the SABMiller acquisition and the use of AI in ABInBev’s Global Compliance program”, ECLA Legal Disruption Conference, Dublin, Ireland
- “Leadership Development Roundtable: Beyond Reporting to the CLO: The Expanding Roles of Regional and Deputy General Counsel”, ACC Annual Conference, Austin, USA
- “How to deal with  different legal systems?”, IBJ (Association of In-House Lawyers in Belgium), Belgium
- “Thinking global vs. thinking regional – how to build and structure your team across borders”, Corporate Counsel Forum, England
profile_positions.title: Public Speaker/Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
- Responsible for all legal matters, government relations, external communication and corporate social responsibility of the company's Zone Europe (comprised of more than 13 countries)
- Leads a team of +80 in Zone Europe HQ and BUs
- Member of the Global Legal & Corporate Affairs leadership team for AB-InBev
profile_positions.title: Vice President Legal & Corporate Affairs (General Counsel) - Zone Europe

profile_positions.description:
- Member of the Management Committee (Mancom) of AB InBev International (ABII), advising in negotiations with the company's international partners in more than 100 countries, defining/managing  budget for value-maximizing use of legal resources (both internal and external), and leading ABII's corporate affairs, communications and compliance agenda 
- Lead counsel on various external growth initiatives such as the repatriation of the Corona brand in key markets 
- Counsel to the Global Procurement Office (GPO), advising in the negotiation of global procurement agreements of raw materials, packaging and indirects 
- Counsel to the Global IBS team, advising on the negotiations of global IT contracts 
- Part of the deal team working on the proposed SABMiller transaction
profile_positions.title: Global Legal Director, AB InBev International and Global Procurement - GHQ, Belgium

profile_positions.description:
- Principal legal advisor to the Integration Planning PMO responsible for the integration of Grupo Modelo into Anheuser- Busch InBev operations
- Supported the Zone Mexico’s Legal Department in establishing anti-corruption, antitrust and other compliance programs
- Lead counsel in a number of divestitures of non-core assets of Grupo Modelo
- Lead counsel to Zone Mexico in the cutover of Grupo Modelo's US business
- Alternate Board Member of Grupo Modelo since 2011 (ongoing)
profile_positions.title: Legal Director, Integration - Zone Mexico

profile_positions.location: New York City, United States of America
profile_positions.description:
- Responsible for leading and advising on legal aspects of global and regional M&A transactions and managing the execution of deals, including the acquisition of Grupo Modelo in Mexico (the producer of Corona) and a number of regional M&A and strategic deals in China and Vietnam
- Primary counsel to the International Market Development group, including participating on its management team, providing legal advice and counsel in the negotiation/termination of commercial relationships with foreign business partners
- Provide support to the Treasury and Investor Relations teams on bond offerings and financing transactions, as well as periodic filings with the SEC (eg. 20-F) and other disclosure matters
- Define and manage the budget for value-maximizing use of legal resources within M&A and International Market Development, including project costs, outside counsel relationships/fees, and L/E updates 
- Develop, implement and leverage best practices for M&A and Securities
- Alternate Board member of Grupo Modelo
profile_positions.title: Global Legal Director, M&A and Commercial - New York

profile_positions.description:
- Served as Board member of ABInBev Efes, a 50:50 venture in Russia and Ukraine from 2018-2019
- Served as a member of the Executive Committee of the Breweries of Europe from 2017-2019
- Served as Board observer of Anadolu Efes, a Turkish publicly listed company, from 2017-2019
- Served as alternate Board member for Grupo Modelo, a Mexican listed company, from 2011-2013
profile_positions.title: Board Member/ExCom member

profile_positions.description:
- Advised private equity firms in bid processes for the acquisition of portfolio companies and in capital raising transactions
- Represented underwriters, initial purchasers and issuers in connection with SEC-registered and unregistered offerings (i.e. Rule 144A/Reg S) of investment-grade and high-yield notes
- Represented underwriters and issuers in initial public offerings of common stock and follow-on equity offerings
- Advised first lien lenders in a “chapter 11” reorganization filed on a “pre-negotiated” basis, and various companies and lenders in the renegotiation of its credit facilities
- Member of STB's Diversity Advisory Council
profile_positions.title: Corporate Associate

profile_positions.description:
- Represented underwriters and issuers in global offerings conducted in Brazil with placement efforts in the United States and Europe
- Advised underwriters and issuers in the offering of equity, bonds, private equity funds (i.e. FIP), receivables funds (i.e. FIDC) and real estate credit certificates (i.e. CRI)
- Represented brokers and dealers in administrative proceedings and compliance with money laundering regulations before Brazil’s Securities and Exchange Commission (CV) and Brazil’s Central Bank
profile_positions.title: Banking Associate

profile_positions.description:
- Advised asset management companies and hedge funds on investment management regulation.
- Represented brokers and dealers in administrative proceedings and compliance with money laundering regulations before Brazil’s Securities and Exchange Commission and Brazil’s Central Bank
- Advised asset management companies in obtaining Brazil’s Securities and Exchange Commission authorization to manage hedge funds 
- Advised in the structuring of various financial products (eg FIDC, FIP, CPR)
profile_positions.title: Securities and Banking Associate
